com.seanchenxi.gwt.storage.client

Class StorageExt

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.seanchenxi.gwt.storage.client.StorageExt

  • public final class StorageExt
extends Object
    Extends the GWT HTML5 Storage API, by adding Object Value Support.

    You can obtain a Storage by either invoking getLocalStorage() or getSessionStorage().

    If Web Storage is NOT supported in the browser, these methods return null.

    Note: Storage events into other windows are not supported.

    This may not be supported on all browsers.

    See Also:
    W3C Web Storage - Storage, Can I use... - Web Storage, GWT Developer's Guide - Client-side Storage (Web Storage), com.google.gwt.storage.client.Storage

        Parameters:

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Removes all items in the Storage, and its cache if activated
        See Also:
        W3C Web Storage - Storage.clear()

      • clearCache

        public void clearCache()
        Clear all cached serialized object from configured StorageCache

      • containsKey

        public <T> boolean containsKey(StorageKey<T> key)
        Test if this storage contains a value for the specified key.

        StorageKeyFactory is preferred to get a StorageKey instance for primitive types.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of stored value
        Parameters:
        key - the key whose presence in this storage is to be tested
        Returns:
        true if this storage contains a value for the specified key.

      • get

        public <T> T get(StorageKey<T> key)
      throws com.google.gwt.user.client.rpc.SerializationException
        Returns the value in the Storage associated with the specified key, or null if this Storage contains no mapping for the key.

        Note : Deserialization will be performed to return a correct value type.
        StorageKeyFactory is preferred to get a StorageKey instance for primitive types.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of stored value
        Parameters:
        key - the key to a value in the Storage
        Returns:
        the value associated with the given key
        Throws:
        com.google.gwt.user.client.rpc.SerializationException
        See Also:
        W3C Web Storage - Storage.getItem(k)

      • getString

        public String getString(String key)
        Get directly the stored string value associated with the specified key.

        Note : No deserialization will be performed

        Parameters:
        key - the key to a value in the Storage
        Returns:
        the stored string value associated with the given key
        See Also:
        W3C Web Storage - Storage.getItem(k)

      • key

        public String key(int index)
        Returns the key at the specified index.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the key
        Returns:
        the key at the specified index in this Storage
        See Also:
        W3C Web Storage - Storage.key(n)

      • put

        public <T> void put(StorageKey<T> key,
           T value)
         throws com.google.gwt.user.client.rpc.SerializationException,
                StorageQuotaExceededException
        Store the specified value with the specified key in this storage.

        Note: null value is not allowed.
        If the storage previously contained a mapping for the key, the old value is replaced.
        StorageKeyFactory is preferred to get a StorageKey instance for primitive types.

        Parameters:
        key - key with which the specified value is to be associated
        value - value to be associated with the specified key
        Throws:
        com.google.gwt.user.client.rpc.SerializationException
        StorageQuotaExceededException

      • remove

        public <T extends Serializable> void remove(StorageKey<T> key)
        Removes the record for the specified key from this storage if present.

        StorageKeyFactory is preferred to get a StorageKey instance for primitive types

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of stored value
        Parameters:
        key - key whose mapping is to be removed from the map

      • setEventLevel

        public void setEventLevel(StorageChangeEvent.Level eventLevel)
        Set Event Level.

        Note : set to StorageChangeEvent.Level.STRING, will prevent the deserialization process in event creation,
        This matters only if the old value (object value) is wanted in every storage change event.

        Parameters:
        eventLevel - the event detail level
        See Also:
        StorageChangeEvent

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns the number of items in this Storage.
        Returns:
        number of items in this Storage
        See Also:
        W3C Web Storage - Storage.length()
